definition: head high/in high spirits/to raise one's head (e.g. of neighing horse)
to lift/to raise/to raise one's head/high/high spirits/soaring/expensive
head/chief/first (occasion, thing etc)/classifier for poems, songs etc
head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut

sentences.english: An Afghan hound stands at attention.
sentences.chinese: 一只阿富汗猎犬昂首肃立。

sentences.english: He bridled up when his enemy spoke to him.
sentences.chinese: 敌人对他说话时，他昂首收颌以示轻蔑。

sentences.english: He became a Congressman at the young age of 29 and brought his frontier swagger to the Senate a year later.
sentences.chinese: 他29岁成为议员并在一年后昂首阔步进入参议院。

sentences.english: Hearing from this, Lixiaoxia has been anoia from grief. Songdanping will sing when it comes to evening, and Xiaoxia is comforted with the songs.
sentences.chinese: 每到夜晚，宋丹萍昂首高歌，晓霞在歌声中得到安慰。

sentences.english: He believe loyalty and industrious will greatly boost corporate success.
sentences.chinese: 他相信忠诚和勤劳会大大促使公司获得成昂首天外功。

sentences.english: My husband looked up and said, 'Mom's here?'
sentences.chinese: 我夫婿昂首看了看，说“母亲来了？”

sentences.english: Peacocks strut in the surrounding meadow.
sentences.chinese: 孔雀在周围的草地上昂首阔步。

sentences.english: They swept into the hall, preceded by trumpeters.
sentences.chinese: 他们以号手为前导昂首阔步走进大厅。

sentences.english: You've never actually stood there and looked up at that beautiful ceiling.
sentences.chinese: 你没试过站在那儿，昂首眺望天花板上的名画吧？

sentences.english: He turned round about and stalked off.
sentences.chinese: 他向后一转，昂首阔步地走开了。

sentences.english: Garrosh Hellscream yells:Then we will stand astride this world as its masters.
sentences.chinese: 然后，我们将以这个世界主人的身份昂首挺立。

sentences.english: The nation can hold its head up high.
She swept in, with her complacency.
sentences.chinese: 她喜形于色地昂首走了进来。

sentences.english: We followed him, making great strides with head up.
sentences.chinese: 我们昂首阔步地跟着他向前走。

sentences.english: They strut and bounce, dance and flounce.
sentences.chinese: 他们昂首阔步，蹦蹦跳跳。

sentences.english: She said, “These women stood straight and suffered fewer falls.
sentences.chinese: 她表示化妆的女性走路时昂首阔步。

definition: head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
upright and unafraid
to stride forward
standing proud
loftily/proudly/unyieldingly
male eagle/tercel (male falcon used in falconry)
elated/high-spirited/uplifting (music)
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
to spread wings
to crane one's neck/(fig.) with one's neck outstretched in expectation
to look disdainfully out of the corner of one's eye
majestic/awe-inspiring presence/impressive power
to strut about
high-spirited/brave-looking
male lion
